problem: Find the coefficient of $x^2$ when $3(x^2 - x^3) +2(x - 2x^2 + 3x^5) -(4x^3 - x^2)$ is simplified.
solution:
When we expand we get  \begin{align*}
&3(x^2 - x^3) +2(x - 2x^2 + 3x^5) -(4x^3 - x^2) \\
&\qquad =3x^2 - 3x^3 +2x - 4x^2 + 6x^5 -4x^3 + x^2\\
&\qquad =6x^5-7x^3+2x.
\end{align*}The coefficient of $x^2$ is $3-4+1=\boxed{0}$.
model_solution:
Step 1: Distribute the coefficients to the terms in each set of parentheses.
$3(x^2 - x^3) +2(x - 2x^2 + 3x^5) -(4x^3 - x^2) = 3x^2 - 3x^3 + 2x - 4x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x^5$
Step 2: Combine like terms.
$3x^2 - 3x^3 + 2x - 4x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x^5 = -7x^3 - 1x^2 + 2x + 6x^5$
Combine like terms.
$-7x^3 - x^2 + 2x + 6x^5 = -7x^3 - x^2 + 2x + 6x^5$
The coefficient of $x^2$ is -1.
The final answer is: $\boxed{-1}$
steps:

full_steps:
Step 1: Distribute the coefficients to the terms in each set of parentheses.
$3(x^2 - x^3) +2(x - 2x^2 + 3x^5) -(4x^3 - x^2) = 3x^2 - 3x^3 + 2x - 4x^3 - 4x^2 + 6x^5$
